long_desc.thetext:
In any of my comboboxes, when I first open them, they are blank (I don't see any of the possible values) and some scrollbars (inside the popup) flickers. And while this lasts, it uses most of my CPU. This situation stops: the scrollbars stop flickering and the content of the combobox (the values) appear when I move the mouse. At this point there is still some "white space" (the size of a vertical scrollbar) to the right of the popup. This white space disappears only if I close the combo and reopen it. For all subsequent open, it works normally.
It seems to be related to the fact that my number of choices is < maxVisibleRows I can reliably reproduce this using the demo at: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/#example~ComboBoxEx_1.html
- open the page, - set "Number of items in list" to 9 - set number of headers to 3, then back to 2 (I think this step simply reset the "popup table"). - open the combobox (without moving the mouse after the click).
For what it's worth, I'm using Firefox 2.0.6. But it might also happen with other browsers.
I could reproduce this behavior in qooxdoo 0.7. However, in 0.8 it does not happen any longer so we will not fix this issue.
Please note that ComboBoxEx will be moved to a contribution in 0.8 and will not be part of the core framework anymore.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
